bool TechnoExt::TechnoExt::ExtData::IsOperated (  ) 

This function checks if this object can currently be used, in terms of having or needing an operator.

Returns:
true if it needs an operator and has one, or if it doesn't need an operator in the first place. false if it needs an operator and doesn't have one.
Author:
Renegade
Date:
27.04.10 
00243                                   {
00244         TechnoTypeExt::ExtData* TypeExt = TechnoTypeExt::ExtMap.Find(this->AttachedToObject->GetTechnoType());
00245 
00246         if(TypeExt->Operator) {
00247                 if(this->AttachedToObject->Passengers.NumPassengers) {
00248                         // loop & condition come from D
00249                         for(ObjectClass* O = this->AttachedToObject->Passengers.GetFirstPassenger(); O; O = O->NextObject) {
00250                                 if(FootClass *F = generic_cast<FootClass *>(O)) {
00251                                         if(F->GetType() == TypeExt->Operator) {
00252                                                 // takes a specific operator and someone is present AND that someone is the operator, therefore it is operated
00253                                                 return true;
00254                                         }
00255                                 }
00256                         }
00257                         // takes a specific operator and someone is present, but it's not the operator, therefore it's not operated
00258                         return false;
00259                 } else {
00260                         // takes a specific operator but no one is present, therefore it's not operated
00261                         return false;
00262                 }
00263         } else if(TypeExt->IsAPromiscuousWhoreAndLetsAnyoneRideIt) {
00264                 // takes anyone, therefore it's operated if anyone is there
00265                 return (this->AttachedToObject->Passengers.NumPassengers > 0);
00266         } else {
00267                 /* Isn't even set as an Operator-using object, therefore we are returning TRUE,
00268                  since, logically, if it doesn't need operators, it can be/is operated, no matter if there are passengers or not.
00269                  (Also, if we didn't do this, Reactivate() would fail for for non-Operator-units, for example.) */
00270                 return true;
00271         }
00272 }

bool TechnoExt::TechnoExt::ExtData::IsPowered (  ) 

This function checks if this object can currently be used, in terms of having or needing a powering structure and that structure's status.

Returns:
true if it needs a structure and has an active one, or if it doesn't need a structure in the first place. false if it needs a structure and doesn't have an active one.
Author:
Renegade
Date:
27.04.10 
00279                                  {
00280         TechnoTypeClass *TT = this->AttachedToObject->GetTechnoType();
00281         if(TT && TT->PoweredUnit) {
00282                 HouseClass* Owner = this->AttachedToObject->Owner;
00283                 for(int i = 0; i < Owner->Buildings.Count; ++i) {
00284                         BuildingClass* Building = Owner->Buildings.GetItem(i);
00285                         if(Building->Type->PowersUnit) {
00286                                 if(Building->Type->PowersUnit == TT) {
00287                                         return Building->RegisteredAsPoweredUnitSource && !Building->IsUnderEMP(); // alternatively, HasPower, IsPowerOnline()
00288                                 }
00289                         }
00290                 }
00291                 // if we reach this, we found no building that currently powers this object
00292                 return false;
00293         } else {
00294                 // object doesn't need a particular powering structure, therefore, for the purposes of the game, it IS powered
00295                 return true;
00296         }
00297 }
